course.subject: GBUS
course.name: Global Leadership Development
course.description: The course is designed to promote students' personal development, teamwork, communications skills, career preparation, leadership capability, and a global mindset. For GBUS students only. Grade PP, P or F.

reviews.author: erm
reviews.comment_content:
- 2 Townhalls, once at the beginning of the semester and the other towards the end of semester: Program director shares about program updates while student initiative teams introduce activities for the semester.
- Global Leadership Forum, usually once per semester: Figures from the industry share about their insights on a particular topic.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass/fail course
There is no grading but you are supposed to attend the townhalls, global leadership forum, and other compulsory activities.
reviews.comment_workload:
No academic workload
You can choose from a range of activities according to your goals and interests.

reviews.author: lyyy
reviews.comment_content: The primary purpose is to gather all GBUS students for internal communications, updates, story sharing and student-led activities. Mostly student-led, with updates from student initiative teams such as recruitment or event promotions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mainly student sharings or updates from professors/staff. No particular curriculum.
reviews.comment_grading: No grades. Only need to make sure you attend all compulsory sessions such as townhall, or if you are of a specific target group (e.g. CV workshops for junior students).
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all. You only need to attend compulsory sessions which happen 2-4 times a semester.

reviews.author: anon123
reviews.comment_content: 2 town halls per semester, one at the beginning, one at the end. A good platform to bond and to share different stories and updates within the community and across all cohorts. Usually has announcements, then 'student initiative team' sharing, and then some sharing from students on topics like their exchange, or world issues.
reviews.comment_teaching: There is no teaching in the course, just sharing between profs and students.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload either unless you are part of a student initiative team or need to prepare for a town hall sharing.

reviews.author: Cherry Yip
reviews.comment_content:
Three Townhalls per year, it is really chill, mainly some updates by initiative teams and introduction to various activities.
Some events include:
- barbecue from Nason's
- Some mingling events
- Inter-school GBUS events
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mainly networking instead of "teaching".
Professor Emily Nason is really nice, would schedule individual meet-up sessions for students who need help on external connections and academic advices.
reviews.comment_grading: A pass/fail course since it is of 0 credits.
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload basically. Prepare slides if you are from initiative teams.
Join the three Townhalls, 1.5hr each.
The town halls are conducted on zoom during Covid situation.

reviews.author: CKsin
reviews.title: class teacher lesson in university
reviews.comment_content:
I would say this is the best course in HKUST.
Chill and relaxing.
You will meet a lot of GBUS students in this course, from year 1 to year 4.
A good chance for you to meet you own cohort.

In this townhall, GBUS initiate team will recruit their members.
TK will inform us about the recent update.
GBUS students and alumni will share their experience.
reviews.comment_teaching: You can just sit and listen to TK's presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance is required.
Literally everyone will get a pass in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
0 workload.
Don't be late, you may have a chance to perform on stage.

reviews.author: Dash
reviews.comment_content: It mainly consists of various activities such as sharing and news for the GBUS cohort. Events are usually held by student initiative teams.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is truly an irreplaceable experience and a good chance to understand the GBUS community in various ways. You can also meet your GBUS cohort there.
reviews.comment_grading: I am pretty sure you can't fail this course. Plus it accounts for 0 credit so you are good to go.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is minimum for this course as all you need to do is to attend the events. Enjoy your time here.

reviews.author: ywh
reviews.title: Chill course
reviews.comment_content:
Very chill, just some sharing from GBUS students and updates from initiative teams.
It is also interesting to hear updates for the whole GBUS major students, there may be some upcoming events you could not miss initiated during the 1.5hr
reviews.comment_teaching:
Could learn more about what the GBUS community is doing.
Interesting stories from GBUS students.
reviews.comment_grading: No grading at all as it is a 0 credit course.
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload at all
Just please sit there and pay attention to what the others are saying on the stage, show your respect and you will know more interesting stories and facts from the GBUS community.

reviews.author: Wowhoho
reviews.comment_content: student oriented, with activities held by student initiative teams (including global exposure team, external relations team, affiliation team, design and communication team, career professional development team, details can be found on website) being a contributor or participant are both fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: great learning and networking experience. good chance to know more about classmates and seniors.
reviews.comment_grading: no worries!! graded pass or fail, probably 100% pass (haven't heard of anyone failed it lol)
reviews.comment_workload: participation in events, one or two a week. not compulsory but students are encouraged to join. events are usually held after class (6pm)

reviews.author: CK Cheung
reviews.title: It is not a taught course and carries no grades
reviews.comment_content: The course is not a 'course' in typical sense, the canvas channel for the course is just used for GBUS internal communication. No need to register for anything.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing 'taught' in the class. I'd say GBUS activities are generally fun and give us chance to meet really interesting people.
reviews.comment_grading: Nothing to mention considering you just have to pass it. Pretty sure no one has ever failed this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. You won’t expect much workload for a 0 credit course I guess. Only task people have to do is writing reflections regularly, which is a good chance for people to ponder a bit.
